Name: Session
Definition: For experiment 0.1, the time period when an animal is placed in the nesting cage until the time the animal is removed from the nesting cage.

Name: Trial
Definition: For experiment 0.1, the time period when an animal starts moving the wheel on a patch until the time a pellet is delivered. Every experiment 0.1 session ends on incompleted trials.

Name: Acquisition Run
Definition: The time period when the acquistion computer is on and acquiring data until it is stopped. For experiment 0.1 there are multiple acquisition runs due to Bonsai/Windows being restarted.

Name: Acquisition Chunk
Definition: The time period in which datastream files are written out. For experiment 0.1, datastreams were written out in files corresponding to 1 hour time periods..

Name: Aeon Unit
Definition: The minimum time resolution a user can get from an initial query of a Datajoint table (the timebin size of BLOB and QC data stored in Datajoint tables). For experiment 0.1 the aeon unit was 10 minutes.

Name: Task Protocol
Definition: An integer number and associated string describing a unique behavioral task run in Project Aeon. For experiment 0.1, there were 8 task protocols...
